Package io.aiven.kafka.connect.common.source.input

Class Transformer.StreamSpliterator

java.lang.Object
io.aiven.kafka.connect.common.source.input.Transformer.StreamSpliterator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Spliterator<org.apache.kafka.connect.data.SchemaAndValue>
Enclosing class:
Transformer
protected abstract static class Transformer.StreamSpliterator extends Object implements Spliterator<org.apache.kafka.connect.data.SchemaAndValue>
A Spliterator that performs various checks on the opening/closing of the input stream.

  • Field Details

    • logger

      protected final org.slf4j.Logger logger
      The logger to be used by all instances of this class. This will be the Transformer logger.

    • inputStream

      protected InputStream inputStream
      * The input stream. Will be null until inputOpened(java.io.InputStream) has completed. May be used for reading but should not be closed or otherwise made unreadable.

  • Method Details

    • doAdvance

      protected abstract boolean doAdvance(Consumer<? super org.apache.kafka.connect.data.SchemaAndValue> action)
      Attempt to read the next record. If there is no record to read or an error occurred return false. If a record was created, call action.accept() with the record.
      Parameters:
      action - the Consumer to call if record is created.
      Returns:
      true if a record was processed, false otherwise.

    • doClose

      protected abstract void doClose()
      Method to close additional inputs if needed.

    • close

      public final void close()

    • inputOpened

      protected abstract void inputOpened(InputStream input) throws IOException
      Allows modification of input stream. Called immediatly after the input stream is opened. Implementations may modify the type of input stream by wrapping it with a specific implementation, or may create Readers from the input stream. The modified input stream must be returned. If a Reader or similar class is created from the input stream the input stream must be returned. The inputStream instance variable will be null until inputOpened(java.io.InputStream) has completed. The implementation of the interface is responsible for closing any newly constructed readers or input streams in the doClose() method.
      Parameters:
      input - the input stream that was just opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - on IO error.
